botanical_details.genus: Allium are bulbous herbaceous perennials with a strong onion or garlic scent, linear, strap-shaped or cylindrical basal leaves and star-shaped or bell-shaped flowers in an umbel on a leafless stem

how_to_grow.cultivation: Thin plants to 15cm apart. Water in dry weather and feed every two weeks with a general purpose fertiliser. Cease watering and feeding once bulbs have swollen in mid-summer. Onions can be harvested as soon as they're big enough to use. See advice profiles for onions and shallots for further information
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed sown under glass in early spring, or outdoors in April. Sets may be planted out in April
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to onion fly and allium leaf miner
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to onion white rot, leek rust and onion downy mildew
